resources.string: Manage WLAN, Bluetooth, airplane mode, cellular networks, & VPNs
Automatically connect to available networks with a WLAN Assistant.
Google WLAN Assistant automatically connects you to the best available WLAN
Google WLAN Assistant detects the networks available to you and connects your device to the one with the best speed and reliability.
To help protect your data, Google WLAN Assistant may provide a secure VPN connection through Google servers.
WLAN Assistant" wants to set up a VPN connection that allows it to monitor network traffic. Only accept if you trust the source.
You gave “Google WLAN Assistant” permission to set up a VPN connection. That means this app can monitor network traffic.
Don\'t use a WLAN network unless it has a good Internet connection
Let Google\'s location service and other apps scan for networks, even when WLAN is off
Let a WLAN assistant manage your WLAN connection
Minimize battery usage when WLAN is on
To see available networks, turn WLAN on.
You don\'t have permission to change the WLAN network.
To complete setup, your tablet needs access to WLAN. After setup, you can switch between cellular data and WLAN.
Press the WLAN Protected Setup button on your router. It may be called \"WPS\" or contain this symbol:
Enter pin %1$s on your WLAN router. The setup can take up to two minutes to complete.
WARNING: if you skip WLAN, your tablet will only use cellular data for initial downloads and updates. To avoid possible data charges, connect to WLAN.
WARNING: if you skip WLAN, your device will only use cellular data for initial downloads and updates. To avoid possible data charges, connect to WLAN.
WARNING: if you skip WLAN, your phone will only use cellular data for initial downloads and updates. To avoid possible data charges, connect to WLAN.
WARNING: If you skip WLAN, your tablet won\'t have an Internet connection to use for any initial downloads or updates.
WARNING: If you skip WLAN, your device won\'t have an Internet connection to use for any initial downloads or updates.
WARNING: If you skip WLAN, your phone won\'t have an Internet connection to use for any initial downloads or updates.
The tablet was unable to connect to this WLAN network.
The device was unable to connect to this WLAN network.
The phone was unable to connect to this WLAN network.
Use cellular connection to provide WLAN network
AndroidAP WPA2 PSK portable WLAN hotspot
Use GPS, WLAN, and cellular networks to determine location
Use WLAN and cellular networks to determine location
Increase WLAN logging level, show per SSID RSSI in WLAN Picker
When enabled, WLAN will be more aggressive in handing over the data connection to Cellular, when WLAN signal is low
Allow/Disallow WLAN Roam Scans based on the amount of data traffic present at the interface
Turn off WLAN when not using it or when it isn\'t available
Back up app data, WLAN passwords, and other settings to Google servers
Stop backing up your WLAN passwords, bookmarks, other settings, and app data, plus erase all copies on Google servers?
You can\'t configure an EAP WLAN connection during setup. After setup, you can do that in Settings > Wireless & networks.
Touch Next to continue with setup.\n\nTouch Back to connect to a different WLAN network.
If you restrict background cellular data, some apps and services won\'t work unless you\'re connected to WLAN.
If you restrict background cellular data, some apps and services won\'t work unless you\'re connected to WLAN.\n\nThis setting affects all users on this tablet.
If you restrict background cellular data, some apps and services won\'t work unless you\'re connected to WLAN.\n\nThis setting affects all users on this phone.
To select metered networks, turn WLAN on.
Allow modification of WLAN and Mobile settings

To improve location accuracy and for other purposes, Google and other apps may scan for nearby networks, even when WLAN is off. If you don\'t want this to happen, go to Advanced > Scanning always available.
Apps may scan for nearby networks, even when WLAN is off. If you don\'t want this to happen, go to Advanced > Scanning always available.
To improve location accuracy and for other purposes, %1$s wants to turn on network scanning, even when WLAN is off.\n\nAllow this for all apps that want to scan?
